We cannot get a loan if the payments are being deferred; they refuse to put the loan in forbearance until the deferment is up. My boyfriend was told that he could get off the loan once 24 payments have been made. He wants to make those 24 payments in one lump sum to get off the loan; they will not do that. They say the payments have to be made monthly. Basically, any way that they can help us is being denied when all we really need is the payment information.

name: Shar
review: When I first finished school before beginning employment, I was under forbearance (naturally). Then through the years, I began paying as soon as I could. Later, I bought a home and kept paying student loans and mortgage. My employment ended and I was in between jobs choosing to keep my mortgage paid over education loans. I began getting numerous calls, once at 5am (because the caller was in the East Coast and didn't care that I'm on Pacific Time). At any rate, every time they call they insist coercively for payment over the phone using a bank routing, which I simply refuse. At times, I've even just put the check in the mail and tell them so. But they ask me to pay over the phone and cancel the check. And they always drive the conversation to a point of asking on the recorded call "So you are refusing to pay?!" I explain, "No, I am paying you, just not now because I don't have the fund in my account yet, or I just did through the mail." But they always keep coercing me for a payment, which is basically asking do something illegal and fraudulent akin to writing a bad check.In July 2008, at a time I was unemployed, I tell the supervisor whom I'd asked for (because the caller couldn't understand "I don't have the money") that I'm unemployed, and they will be paid when I have the funds. The supervisor tells me "Well, why don't you go get a job?" Naturally, my fuse blew at that point. I lost it and advised him with creative activities using various body parts. What's next, sending someone over to break my knee caps? (At least if they came over to pay me a visit like a loan shark, I could respond with my fists or a baseball bat.) At that point, I realized the supervisors in Sallie Mae manage and lead a team with the goal of calling to coerce and harass people who are behind or unable to pay their payments.I am angered beyond the edge of my limit. I am enslaved by Sallie Mae with no legal recourse. To have a customer service supervisor tell me to look for a job (when I was and was actually waiting for a contract to start up) was beyond infuriating. This lender is insane. That was 9 months ago. Unfortunately, my contract ended, and I am again unemployed. Even for an educated skilled web worker like me, economic conditions don't care if I have used up my forbearance. My unemployment check goes to pay Sallie Mae, not other needs. I'll have to forfeit/foreclose my home because I can't dissolve education loans through bankruptcy. I see no options and my credit is screwed either way. The constant calls encroach on my personal life, wellness, and sanity. To keep a sense of humor through this, I have to adopt a case of adult onset Tourette's syndrome (triggered by Sallie Mae).

name: Deborah
review: I attended school from Oct. 2003 until June 2006 where I earned my Bachelors of Fine Arts Degree. (Before I tell you my story, let me first tell you that I have paid off two student loans in the past.) To go to school, I did not have money and had to rely on student loans. Every time a quarter would come up, I had to go and sign for my loans. Some were signature loans. I was never advised that they were different from any other loan and all of them were approved by Sallie Mae. Once done with school, I got the bill in the mail for $90,000.00. First off, I was floored (I should have noticed the high amounts, but I wanted to go and finish school). I am an older woman and just divorced after 25 years. I needed more money.The billings started after 6 months, and I was floored again. I would owe each month around $2,300.00. I found out by contacting them that the signature loans were high interest loans. One was 21% and the least one was 17%. That was the majority of the money I received from them. I was able to consolidate around $20,000 for a payment of $127.00 a month through a bank other than Sallie Mae. So I owe around $70,000. I contacted Sallie Mae and told them that for one, I did not even make that much in a month. So they gave me a forbearance. This kept on going on until just recently when I ran out of forbearance time. They give you 5. I still cannot afford the payments and asked several people if they could work with me and accept what I could afford. (During the past year, my mother who lived with me and helped me with the mortgage and food committed suicide; then, I had no money left for bills or the mortgage.) My house just now went into foreclosure and I had to declare bankruptcy. I tried to talk to these people. They seem to think that money grows on trees. I went through my bills with them (car payment, rent utilities, plus my son is out of a job and I have to help him as well). I want to pay this debt, but I can only afford $100.00 a month. I tried to explain and ask how come the mortgage companies can lower the interest rates and they can't. I did not get an explanation. I was just told that is not the way they operate.I need help. Since I moved, my phone number had changed. So they found my work number (I did not give that to them). Now, I am getting harassed at work 3 to 4 times daily. Can they do that? I am a hardworking, tax-paying citizen that has fallen down on her luck, and no one seems to care. If you can help me, I'd appreciate it. I was hoping that the bankruptcy would take that debt away and then was told it does not. These people are worse than the bill collectors were, calling me all day long at work. I am very upset and need someone on my side. Like I said, I don't want to default; but at this point, I don't really have a choice. They told me that unless I make the whole payment, they will come after me. Is this America? I feel like I live in a communist country where my rights are being taken away from me. Please help me if you can.

name: Melissa
review: I had graduated from Dean in 2002. Before I even graduated, I got my first bill from Sallie Mae. I was good for a year paying them off. Then I lost my job, and I could no longer pay them. I got a job and started paying again. Okay, so now 6 years later, I have filed bankruptcy, changed jobs, have had a family and just don't make enough to payback. Now, they have threatened me that they will take my whole paycheck every week and my taxes. Basically, I put my family out on the streets. Did you know that when you give Sallie Mae your money they just give it right back to the President? He's gotten enough of my money to bail people out; I don't think he needs more. Sallie Mae steals money and harasses you. I have gotten calls 11 times a day. Isn't there a law about harassment calls? If I quit or lose my job, they'll take the money out of my husbands two jobs. Never ever get a loan with Sallie Mae. What a mistake. Maybe I should have never gone to school. I work and don't see my paycheck. Sallie Mae now gets the whole thing.

name: Jessica
review: Since November of 2008, I have been trying to change my payment due date from the 24th of the month to the 1st of the month, which is logical because that is when I get paid. They tell me to fax them a letter with my request and signature, and they will change it within the next month. This has not happened, and I have faxed a letter every month since then. All I can speak with is people from India (which I love) but do not speak very good English. I can pay the same amount. I just need to change my due date. I guess they are making a killing off my late fees. Is this legal?

name: Antoinette
review: After speaking with so many individuals regarding student loans through Sallie Mae, I realized how this system is set up to ruin you, both emotionally and financially. I am a public school teacher to special needs students in a low-income area. I have continually requested loan forgiveness since I am a public servant, yet they continually refuse me. According to the requirements, I qualify for this loan forgiveness program, yet they will not comply with the law! I beg you to please, please bring all these individuals together for a class action lawsuit and an appeal to the government to help these responsible people who attempted to educate themselves and now can't even make ends meet. ** I may have to stop teaching, something I really love in in order to get a better paying job just to survive. My payments are $778 per month, but will be higher by the time all the interest adds up. Help us please!

name: Jodine
review: On 4-1-09, I contacted Sallie Mae to request a a letter for a mortgage lender. I needed it to say I am in forbearance and the estimate amount of my monthly payment under standard repayment. I was told I would have it in 7 days. I called back on 4-2-09 to double check if I had requested the right letter. They had no record of me calling on the first, but they would be happy to send out the letter and I would have it in 7 days. Cool! On 4-9-09, I called because I hadn't received the letter. They showed it was generated on 4-7-09. But no problem, I would receive it by email that night. On 4-10-09, I called them because I never received the email. I was told that letter could not be sent via email and their records show my letter was sent on 4-7-09 (mmm, thought it was generated on 4-7). I asked them to resubmit the request just to be safe as it is the only thing standing between me and a home loan. They said they would. On 4-13-09, I called and was told again that the letter was sent on the 7th. No request for a second letter showed in their files. I again requested a second letter be generated. On 4-14-09, I called to see if the request for a second letter was showing in their records. It wasn't. I went to their website and clicked on the contact us link and explained what was happening, and that I was very upset with their customer service. This is what I received in reply:Thank you for your inquiry and for your business with Sallie Mae. We believe in providing quality customer service and are continually updating our procedures at all facilities to ensure this commitment is met. I am very sorry that we fell short of that goal. Thank you for bringing your experience to our attention so that we may identify ways to improve our service. We at Sallie Mae look forward to providing you with the service you deserve. According to our records, the letter was sent to you via email on April 7, 2009. You should have received the letter within 24 to 48 hours. I have resent the letter to you via email. You should receive the letter in approximately 24 to 48 hours. If we may be of further assistance, please visit our website at www.salliemae.com.I thought it couldn't be sent via email! 15 days and counting. I could be in freaking escrow right now. Without this letter, I can't qualify for the USDA loan and have to go FHA, which means I need $5,000 to $8,000 vs $0 out of pocket with USDA. Thank you Sallie Mae for the wonderful service.

name: Dana
review: I obtained graduate school loans through Sallie Mae to become a school counselor. For years, I have begged Sallie Mae to let me make payments of $100.00 - $200.00 a month, as I work in a low-income area. Sallie Mae has repeatedly refused, saying that my request does not match their formula. The only option they have ever offered is forbearance, which of course makes my loan larger. What began as a $20,000.00 loan is now $53,000 (which, by the way, is more than my yearly salary)! I need help with this ongoing issue. I have tried over the years to speak with supervisors, etc., to no avail. This is very frustrating. I am placed in a position of helplessness, and moreover, it feels unethical.

name: Maryellen
review: I call Sallie Mae constantly. I wrote a letter, but to no avail. When I did get through two weeks ago or so, a person with an accent from out of the country said they would send me a credit history - which they did for the years 2004-2005. I am paying such a high interest, but it says $4.75%. I am trying to pay off the whole loan and send quadruple payments. According to my calculations, I owe $800.00. They say I owed $1,494.00. But on all the bills they send you or even online accounts that I try to manage, the interest applied is always different. You have to be a super CPA to understand this. I took out $5,000 in 2004, returning for a second grad degree to be a teacher in early childhood. I went into deferment, yet made good on payments when I could. I have paid around $7,000, which is a lot of interest on a $5,000 loan. No one could tell me that I would be paid off if I did my final outstanding principal. I am going to write to my senators and congressmen as well as you because I am getting nowhere. They are harassing me, saying I am past overdue yet even though I want to pay it off, they can't seem to tell me what that is. Very confusing and frustrating. The website looks like sales, sales, sales from hell. I have very good credit, but I fear they will ruin it. I will never take loans again and after the trouble with them in the beginning. They sold me this loan like a car salesman and did not let me know what it would entail, so I stopped and began paying school with my credit cards. They are a big mess. They constantly hang up on you even when you ask a simple question. I have been hung up on twenty times or so and all I said was my name sometimes (I have never gotten the chance to get a manager or get mad at them, I wish!). I need help and so does the rest of America! Scary!

name: Elisia
review: I was attending a respiratory program when I applied for a career training loan from Sallie Mae. The company and I spoke on the phone several times. I gave them all my information and told them I was attending Simi Valley adult school. They told me that my school was covered under the career training loan and to go online and find my school under the city name. I found Simi Valley Score and filled out my personal info. I signed off on the loan, which was the biggest mistake of my life! The first disbursement was never received by my school nor I. I had to cancel the rest and drop out of school due to no funds for my tuition. I only had one year left. I was so depressed for months. I am now being charged for the loan that I never had. I am now in default because I am not paying for a loan I never received. My school and I have sent many letters to Sallie Mae notifying them that we never received the check and to please do an investigation to find out where the check was sent, and to put a stop on the check. They have done nothing to help me, but ruin my life and credit. I found out where the check was sent, but they still have not helped me. Please, I am crying out for help!

name: Melissa
review: After graduating just before the recession in May '08, I was due for repayment of my loans - four separate ones, making my payment over $700 a month. Just to get 3 month forbearance, I had to pay $150, which does not go to my balance. 2 months later, I was told that I had to pay another one. When I called to make the second payment to extend my forbearance, I asked to speak to the person and extension I had spoken with the first time, as she said I could contact her directly. I was hung up on by the first accented person after he refused to transfer me and I asked why. The second person said they do not have the capability to transfer my call, which is absurd. Heaven forbid I am allowed to discuss my loan situation with someone who may be familiar with me. I constantly get hung up on when asking questions they do not want to answer. I get told something different every time I call. The first time I tried to get forbearance, I was told that deferments were not allowed for financial hardship. How can they expect a grad to pay $700 a month in a recession, after graduating a few months prior? How is financial hardship given the global economy not grounds for them to work with me on this? It is unbelievable. After getting two short forbearances, I am now told that I will have to make a payment of almost $800 to get 3 month forbearance, once this one ends. If I could do that, I would make a payment!Their practices are unfair and completely irrational. They ruin people's credit as soon as they get out of school, making it impossible to move forward in life and actually become financially stable. I'm going to graduate school in a few months, but if I don't make a payment once this is up in the month span between the end of my forbearance and my school enrollment, I'll have the 20 calls a day back on my phone from collections. Trying to pay for school in cash to avoid taking more loans will surely keep me from making an $800 payment. I'm terrified about the other stories of trying to consolidate, as I will do anything to consolidate my loans with another company to avoid having to deal with their unethical business practices.

name: Grazziani
review: I spoke to a girl call Michelle at Sallie Mae. She stated that my private loan is $2500. I set up an agreement with her; $50 today, another $50 in 2 weeks, and $100 next month. She said, "Okay, you can do that." The next day, I got a phone call from a very rude person saying if I don't pay, they will put me in collections and they will get their money one way or another. I told her I had an agreement with that lady, but she kept saying that they can't do agreements and I was wrong. She has been very unprofessional and ugly. I asked for a supervisor and she put me on hold for 15 minutes. She came back and said that the supervisor was busy and can't talk to me. I advised her to have him call me, but I keep having calls from her and I'm just wondering if those calls aren't recorded, and is there anything we can do as low income people. Please, someone help me because I am losing my mind with them.

name: Shannon
review: I have a student loan with Sallie Mae for my doctorate degree. Several times, I have been incorrectly billed on my accrued interest. My accrued daily interest is supposed to be at a rate of $8.56 per day. During the course of several months, the accrued interest will go up to $10, and today it is up to $16.53 with no reason. I have called several times. They disconnect the phone on me, don't respond to my emails, and continue to charge me outrageous amounts each time I call to complain.

name: Francesca
review: I have private and federal loans with Sallie Mae to go to culinary school In Scottsdale, AZ, a total of 58 thousand dollars. But by the time I get done paying, it will be around 150 thousand dollars. The thing is, when I was in school, they said my loans would be around $180 a month. Cool, no problem. By the time I was out of school, I only make $10 an hour, if lucky. I called Sallie Mae to start paying. They said that I would have to pay over $700 each month. How do I do that if I have rent and other bills? I got a forbearance and had to pay $100 just to process the paperwork. Hello?! I could have used that towards some of the payment! Once the paperwork went through, I was able to pay $186 for four months. I was laid off and had to get another one. I paid my $100 like the first time but, this time, I was told I didn't have to pay anything, which was weird, and they only gave it to me for 2 months! I also met my husband in culinary school who also has student loans. Between us, we have to pay so much money a month that there is no way we could live. Once my husband was done with school, his child's mother hit him with child support (over $400 a month and that's based off $10 an hour) because she had the son when my husband went to school. How can just us, little people coming out of school, expect any of this when they are telling us it will be easy? And we're making only $10 an hour.

name: Tania
review: I have had a loan with Sallie Mae since 2000. I graduated three years ago and went into payment for a $65,000 loan. Payments were made monthly on my loan upwards of $1,834 a month. A payment was never missed. I recently started a new job and wanted to pay off the remainder of my loan. I called for a 10-day payoff and sent money in thinking I would be out from under my student loan for good. I was surprised when a month later I got a statement from Sallie Mae saying I had a balance of almost $2,000. I went back and looked over all my information and was confident this was an error on their part.I called Sallie Mae and spoke with two different people. The first person was rude, indifferent, and sounded like a robot repeating the same thing over and over. He said they had only given me the 10-day payoff on one of my two loans. The payoff on that loan would have been around $9,000, but I had sent in enough to amazingly cover both loans. After explaining this to him, he repeated the same answer. After about 30 minutes with this individual, I asked to be transferred to his supervisor. I was connected to someone who stated his name was Steven ** (I have my doubts to his real name). At any rate, I started anew with my concerns and he stated the same thing as the first individual. I proceeded to explain how this was impossible and he stated there was no record of my calling for a 10-day payoff. In the same breath, he said that they had only given me the 10-day payoff for one of my loans.After going around and around for another 40 minutes, he finally said there had been a processing error. I asked what this meant and he said they had put someone else's payment in my account six months ago. Only after I tried to do the right thing and pay off my loan did they catch this error - they charged me for the interest on the missing money. I can only imagine how much money they make off of these errors. I would not recommend getting a loan through them because despite wanting to do the right thing, they will eventually get every bit from you and then figure out how to squeeze out more. They have the upper hand in the process and you can write in to dispute the problem. But in the meantime, interest is accruing and it is a long process at that.

name: Brandon
review: I took out loans to attend Full Sail Real World Education in Winter Park, Florida. I took out both federal loans and private loans through Sallie Mae. I graduated and I now teach in the same area I attended school. Since graduation, I have never been able to make a single payment to Sallie Mae. My first payment range was $1,200 on a $65,000 loan. Then was reduced to $800 a month, which I still cannot pay. I only bring home around $2,000 a month and I have rent, car payment, insurance and other bills that eat up my income. Sallie Mae has been one of the worst companies I've ever dealt with and more than often when I engage in a conversation with them about my account, they yell at me and hang up. Of course they say I am not willing to pay, but I ask them "Pay with what?" I have to say to anyone who is thinking of dealing with Sallie Mae, please think long and hard about it. These guys have special permissions because they are their own collections agency and can quite literally call you on the phone while you're talking to them (this has happened to me).

name: Mike
review: Sallie mae set me up for a forbearance, Then ten calls after on the same day, saying I'm behind and need to pay. Los of fees have been added and forbearances weren't delivered. I'm on disability due to mental breakdown...this is making things much worse. Can we sue?

name: Rachel
review: I had spoken to Sallie Mae on 2/26/09, i informed them I have been unemployed for 14 months and WANT to make payments but will like for the payments to be lowered, I was told it was a $50 fee and I will be sent paperwork. The paperwork never came. Now they sent me to collections. When you call them now the phone line constantly hangs up and is tranferred to a office in India in which S. Peters could not help me at all and transferred me to another line that hangs up. All I want is to be honest and pay what I owe and they are making this impossible. They are bullies.I am now in collections and was never notified of it.

name: Debra
review: I have never been in a default status with Sallie Mae. I was approved for  a forebearance with them due to a financial hardship but my account was never in default. I received a letter saying that my loans were paid of by another company and that I should contact that company about repayment. Upon contacting that company I was told that they took over my loans because they were in default. I was also told that they had put me in collections. Upon further discussion about this matter I found out that I was put in a default status because I had filed a chapter 13. I was told at the time of filing a chapter 13 that school loans could not be included. I was told that I would still be reponsible for making payments on my school loans. Therefore I donot feel that Sallie Mae acted appropriately in saying that my loans were in default. Filing a chapter 13 does not put my loans in default. I was not required to start making any payments to Sallie Mae until April of 09 because of the forebearance status. I called Sallie Mae to try to discuss this matter but I  was not able to talk to anyone that I could understand. The representatives there did not speak English well enough to understand what I was trying to express and I had difficulty understanding them. It became very frustrating for me. The company who now has the loan told me to contact Sallie Mae so I feel like I am just getting the run around. I was never informed that my loan was being taken over by another company. I did not receive a certified notification regarding this matter therefore I was unaware of the lie perpertrated by Sallie Mae which stated that my loan was in default which was absolutely untrue.I was put in collections by this new company and this will effect any tax refunds that I might be entitled to in the future.

name: C.
review: I am so fed up and stressed out with Sallie Mae. They do not care to help their customers. I have been dealing with them since December 2007. I first called them after I graduated from school because I got laid off of my two jobs and could not get unemployment so I had no income. The first thing that mad me very upset was that they had to nerve to ask me why did I get laid off of my jobs. Please tell me what the meaning of laid off from a job means. It means a job cannot pay its employees anymore and have no hours to offer to work. They made me pay $150 fee just to defer my private student loans for 6 months. Then after I deferred for 6 months, tney told me that consolidation is  no longer an option for any customers. Now, they want me to pay $400 a month in student loan payments. Granted I have a full time job unlike many others, however I do not make that much money. Sallie Mae gave me the option to be homeless and not be able to eat or pay them each month. They are rude and not understanding with the economy that we have today. I did not refuse to make a payment, however I cannot pay $400 a month on a loan paymnet, I offered to pay about $50 a month which is the most I can afford after rent, light bill, phone bill, water, gas, food, medical bills, car insurance, car maintenance,  and federal loan payments, however they refused my offer and threatening to say if I do not pay the $400 a month, that it would go to collections, then I would have to go to court, and then they would begin to draft the money out of my checking account that wouldn't even have that amount in it. After spending an hour on the phone with a rep one day, he asked me how much all of bills were a month and said he could bring my monthly bill down to $252 for 1 year however they still do not seem to understand that I cannot afford that either. The rep had me set up a payment via credit card for the month of february and said they I can pay online with my credit card if needed. Now when he took my credit card payment over the phone, he did not mention a processing fee of $14.95 for using a credit card, which was not applied, however the next month when I went to go make my payment online with my credit card, online only gives you the option to make a checking or savings account payment which I do not have either. I called in to make a credit card payment and then are told that there is  a $14.95 processing fee each time I make a credit card payment, now I can't win for losing. I have tried to meet them 1/2 way, and I still get screwed each month. I wish that I would have never taken a dime from these bastards to go to school. All they want is there money in full when they want it and do not try to work with people and they monthly incomes.Dealing with Sallie Mae has not only raised the balance of the loan amount that I already owe which is almost $40,000, however it has caused me to go into more credit card debt. I am financially, mentally, and emotionally drained from this company and it is not fair.

name: Cathy
review: I have a student loan with sally mae and I am willing to pay my loan off after a year of being out of school I am working but not making a whole lot only if sally mae had called me I would have been willing to allow them to take what they needed to take out of my check but they are so nasty that they could not and would nopt allow me to do that that started a garnishment on my check and gave me no option at all @ 15% of my small pay which is now going to force me to go int bankruptcy and seem like nobody will get anything much. I make very little money now I am about to lose my home, my car, maybe the only job out their for me.I can;t buy grocery with what I would bring home after sally mae.

name: Brian
review: Over the last 7 years I've paid $106,000 on a $65,000 total loan amount, but Sallie Mae has told me in writing that I still owe over $98,000. How could this be? The loan is growing faster than I can pay it off.

name: Jessica
review: I have private student loans with Sallie Mae, and have just graduated and entered repayment, however, I have not found an actual job so I cannot make the full payments. Yesterday morning, I called and spoke with someone who gave me three options, and when I told him which one I wanted to impliment, he transferred me to the wrong department, and then I was transferred back to the ORIGINAL line, as if I had just called in, and I had to wait another 10 minutes before a customer service representative came on the phone. When I spoke with the second representative, he transferred me and disconnected the call.  That evening, I called back and spent 47 minutes on the phone with the rudest, most incompetant person I have ever spoken to in my life. He kept telling me that this would be alot easier if he didn't have to process a partial payment forbearance, as if I was trying to make his life harder-- I wish I had enough money to pay the entire loan off! He could not figure out how to answer a simple question, such as if he could take a check instead of a check card. And, I was charged $150 processing fee for the forebearance, plus $14.95 for each of the three payments I have to make. This is also the second time I've been forced to pay $150 fee. Is there anything that can be done to get the loans to another company? Or, at least may paying my loan off more reasonable? I am shocked at the level of incompentance and harassment that such a company gets away with, especially when compared to over loan companies who actually want to help you get to a solution!

name: Chaseenia
review: First I attended The Art Institute who promised job placement after graduation and that did not happen. I was skeptical about getting private loans but because because I just KNEW I was goingto get help with job placement, I was put at ease.  I got the loan for two years and it amounted up tp almost $40,000 for an associates degree! Now, a year later, Sallie Mae has been calling me, emailing me, sending letters, and leaving messages. I spoke to them several times and explained that I had a baby and was out of a job for a while and that I could pay them between 50-75 because I was just getting back on my feet.Several agents told me that that was not enough to pay them and that I had to pay the minimum of almost $300 per month just for my private loan! Who can afford that these days. I want to pay something but it is not what they want. Like so many others, they are affecting my credit as well. I feel at ease as to what is going to happen next. I do not want them to garnish my wages because I have to live and provide for my child. They don't seem to care about any of this. No one predicted that the economy would turn out this way. Never the less it has and there should be some line of compromise to work together.

name: Barbara
review: My husband has private student loans through sallie mae, i am the cosigner.  We have tried numerous times to talk with them about our payment options.  they have told us that they have done all they can do.  We have 2 small kids, we both work full time, we have bills.  We are not trying to get out of paying it, we are tyring to work with them.  They are so rude.  I just feel there has ti be some one out there some where who can help us deal with them.  we made payments to get current and they still reported it to the credit agencies.  Resulting in a drop of 100 points in our credit rating.

name: Aaron
review: I contacted Sallie Mae to confirm my payment amount for the month of March 2009.  I had previously been signed up to a payment plan of partial interest payments for a period of 3 months beginning in December of 2008.  I confirmed with the representative that my March 2009 payment amount was roughly $1000 and proceeded to pay that amount online on March 16th.  On March 17th I noticed that roughly $500 was removed from my account by Sallie Mae.  I immediately called, concerned because this is the same amount that was taken out of my account through the partial interest payment plan that had reached the end of it's term already.    I was informed that, no, the partial payment plan would take 4 months of automatic payments from my account (the first of which being a good faith payment) instead of the 3 months that was promised to me.  I was told there was no way to refund or cancel that payment. However, I would be able to contact my bank and put a stop payment on the $1000 that I had made and send in an adjusted payment for the difference in order to balance out my payments to equal my regular monthly amount due.  My bank could not stop payment because it was due to post that day.  I called Sallie Mae and was assured that I would be able to process a refund request for the difference once that payment was posted to my bank account.  This morning I called Sallie Mae and spent close to half an hour on the phone with their representative, who assured me on more than one occasion that the refund request had been submitted.  I had him thoroughly go over the process of a refund request and confirm once more that the request was submitted before getting off the phone.  After hanging up, I immediately called Salle Mae back to confirm that the request had been submitted.  This has become a habit with me because LITERALLY every time I speak with an agent there I am lied to and fed misinformation inevitably only to find myself in a MUCH worse predicament than what I was in before I called.  The new representative I got informed me that no refund request had been made, and that no notes of my conversation appeared on my account.  If I hadn't called back and confirmed that this request had been sent I would never have seen my money again. The previous agent basically spent half an hour on the phone doing absolutely NOTHING.    At that point I informed the representative that, while I respect them and the work they do, I can't trust one word that comes out of their mouth and requested to speak to a supervisor.  Angelina, the supervisor, walked me through the refund request process.  She asked me to fax a copy of my bank statement to their office so that they could confirm that the payments had posted to my account.  I asked her to please confirm that she had received my fax and she graciously agreed to.  She even offered to contact me by phone in order to do so.  This was an hour and a half ago.  I have sent the fax twice now.  I'm still waiting for that confirmation call.As a result of the incompetence and mismanagement I've been subjected to I am now in danger of over-drafting my bank account.  I've had to put a hold on payments for my other (equally important) bills.    To make matters worse, because of their mistake I have to wait 7-10 business days just to see if my refund request is approved by management before they will process the refund.  This is a serious inconvenience and only one of MANY nightmarish debacles I've been involved in with Sallie Mae.

name: Grant
review: I asked to clearify loans charged since it appeared I was being charged duplicate loan amounts for a specific date- no help at all. Further, the interest keeps my principles up and the loan amount just keeps increasing without a decrease in the principle. It appears that payments are not being credited to the principle but to whereever the Salle Loan Corp wants to apply it.economics hasn't improved- loan just keep increasing because I can't seem to justify were my payments are being applied too- the principle amount keeps increasing.

name: Tamra
review: Tried and tried to work with Sallie Mae.  My daughter who is on welfare and in dire need of assistance can get absolutely no help from this agency.  She is forced to pay 123.00 a month on a 800.00 a month income.  She has two small children and a single parent.  Now they have taken her tax check what little it is, and told her that until 123.00 is paid she will not receive her check.  She is not late on this months payment.  It is due the 19th of this month. They stated they are holding her check until this is paid.  Can they legally do this? before she is late.  We have had so many different contacts with Sallie Mae we are not sure where she stands.  Is there a lawyer out there that handles this kind of problem.  Help.

name: Jarid
review: Ever since college graduation, I have had a constant battle with Sallie Mae misapplying payments, not following through with phone conversations with customer service representatives, and harassing calls from their collections department.  Every time I speak to a representative and show proof that I have made payments according to my schedule of fees, they assure me that they will notate the account and keep this from happening.  I am still having to call every month for misapplied payments, and obligations not being met on the lender end.I have been charged late fees, accrued interested due to my account on the error of Sallie Mae.

name: linda
review: I took a loan with Sallie Mae in 1985. After much bickering with SM about interest rates and payments and job losses I paid the loan off 100% in 2006!!  SM, promised to remove the loan from my credit reports once it was paid. Now that it's paid R. Allabaugh says it will remain on my reports for another 7 years. I have written one letter of complaint after another, to SM. All my letters fall on deaf ears.  I need this 100% paid (Sallie Mae)loan off my credit reports once and for all!Sallie Mae is continues to ruin my credit and for what? I would die first before I ever returned to SM for educational loan money! Sallie Mae is worse than a loan shark!

name: Kelly
review: Sallie Mae has been harrassing me for months. I did not know that my loans were coming up, never got an email or anything in the mail to let me know a payment was due. After 4 months of being behind I start getting calls telling me that I need to pay now, or they will go after my co-signer and ruin our credit. I told them that there seems to be a problem that I never received anything in the mail, but they told me tough that I needed to pay up. They called my phone about 10 times a day and no one would help me out, I could not do a economic hardship or a forberance with out paying them my late payments and a $150 fee. If I could afford that I would not be in this problem. They are rude and all they do is threaten you when you call them to try to work things out. I lost my job in May of 2008 and have not been successful even with my degree of finding work. Right now I am trying to take care of my son and my self, and living with my parents to try to keep a roof over our heads.

name: Veronica
review: For the 2 months I have been getting 2-5 automated calls a day, even on Sunday.  They even called my job and I never gave them that number.  I am a co-signer on my fiance's account. A couple of times I answered only to be told by a computer to hold for the next representative, I wait, and wait and wait.  After five minutes the line goes dead.  Today they called while I was home for lunch.  I was connected this time to a real person.  He told me that my account was delinquent, which it was.  Due to the Xmas season I had not been able to make the payments for the past 3 months and had +/-$400 past due.  For the past three weeks I had my online banking set up to send $75-100 payment every week.  The last week in February I had set this up after receiving a nasty call from them.  The day before the first payment was scheduled to be delivered to them I got another debt call from them.  I asked to speak with a manager and I got a man who was more nasty than the first.  I told him I had set up on my online banking for them to receive a payment each week for at least $75 until the past due amount was paid.  He said that if I didn't give him the full payment over the phone immediately through their payment system that he would mark my account refusal to pay.  To which I said: I just told you that I have already set up payments through my bank to pay you at least once a week what I can afford each week I am not refusing to pay.  He said that online banking payments will not post right away to my account and therefore my account will be marked even further past due if I didn't do the payment with him over the phone.  I told him that I could not do that cause I had already submitted the payment through my online banking and I couldn't cancel it at that point, and I said that I want it in writing that they will mark my account more delinquent just because I had used online banking. I gave him my fax number and told him that I wanted his comments in writing.  He refused and then hung up.    Today a man called me from Sallie Mae, and I told him that I have set up payments for the next two weeks to bring the account current. He said that I was very delinquent and that I had to set up payment with him immediately to stop the calls.  I said why are you calling me so many times, we only get paid once every week between the two of us and I send you a payment every week.  I can't send you anything more.  He said he was going to mark my account as refusal to pay  and I asked to speak with his boss.  His boss was worse than him!  He admitted that he sees that I have been paying every week but I needed to pay in full today to stop the calls.  I said, no you have to stop the calls because you are harassing me and under THE FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT you are not allowed to harass me. I asked him for his address so that I could put it in writing.  He said  The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act applies only to third party collection companies and we are a first party collection company.  We are following the Act and only do so out of courtesy to our customers.  We can legally do anything we want to to collect a debt.  If we wanted we could call you 75 times a day we could!  -To which I was so upset I started to cry.  I said Are you threatening me? that sounded like a threat.  Can you please clarify that you said you can do anything you want to collect a debt!  He said yes. And then I hung up.Everytime I talk to their agents I am emotionally upset and have a hard time working.  When they called my job they could have gotten me fired and have given my coworkers a bad image of me because I am receiving collection calls at work.

name: Mike
review: My wife and I both have ed loans through Sallie Mae.  We have paid the fees to apply for a forebearance to have one but then to have it made retroactive.  Then we she applies for one she gets it but I didn't and she is a cosigner on my loans.  They call, all the time.

name: Robert
review: We borrowed $8652.00 on 7/22/05 for a student loan. No payments were made the year I was in school. Beginning 01/06 we began making payments of $229.33 every month and continued until now. We have paid approx $6191 to Sallie Mae over the last 2 yrs and Sallie Mae says we owe them more than we did to begin with now.  In fact, they say we now owe them $11,232.29 and still owe six more years of $229.33 in addition to that amt. Sallie Mae has been charging us a variable interest rate all this time and so we owe $3000 more now than we did at the beginning of the loan!  This has got to be illegal. If we continue to pay them at this rate for the next 6 years we will pay at least another additional $16,000 and we have already paid them $6000 - making us pay a total of $22,000 minimum for a loan that was only $8600 to begin with.  We need recourse - this cannot continue.  Help!  What can we do legally?

name: Timothy
review: I have a total of 11,000 in loans with Sallie Mae.  I have been unable to make payments due to low income and a recent move.Now they begin calling to harass me about loans I didn't fully agree upon, toppled with thousands of dollars in fees that I do not understand.I tried to call to put a forebarence on the loan and in attempt to lower the payments, and they REFUSE to talk to me.  I would rather make them spend more than my loan was worth in court fees than to have to deal with them anymore.They will not work with my low income situation, and now they have begun harassing me via phone to demand payments I cannot make.

name: Dana
review: I have a student loan with Sallie Mae.  They've been calling my phone constantly.  I don't know how they got my brother's phone number, but they've contacted him.  My brother didn't have a phone when i applied for the loan, long agao.  Currently I am unable to make monthly payments.  When I do have funds available, a payment is made.  They told me about the loan being given to a credit agency, and funds being taken away via income taxes.  I tried to explain to them that i am not willing to set up payments.  if the funds are not available, i will have to pay an overdraft fee.  i was then told that if i make 3 payments i would be able to have the loan placed in forberance for free.  it is starting to become a problem. i was told that (by a sallie mae rep.) the calls would not stop.    I am stressed.  I am not refusing to pay, and feel like i am force to let another bill go because of their harrassing phone calls.  I feel like i am getting no where.

name: Deborah
review: I sent a letter last Wednesday to Sallie MAe Via E-mail. I sent it to customer service . I've  heard Nothing back as of yet. I would like some answers.   See letter below:1)I have recently called and spoke to a person outside of the US. I asked them why my payment was totally going to Pay Interest Only and not the Principal. I was told the interest is 82.34 and my payment is 82.34. It is not an interest only account. At this rate the principal will never be paid off. 2)My sister CO-Signed for my loan. 1)I have been making payments each month. 2)You have been calling her for a long time to tell her I haven't been paying. 3) You have been excepting payments from me and from my sister. 4)We didn't know we were both making payments.5) I never received a statement that two payments were being made each month and neither did my sister!!!!6)First of all, one payment should go to pay the interest and the second payment should have been for principal only!!!7) The 1098 I that you sent me only reflexs the interest for my payments. You didn't include the interest that was coming out of my sisters second monthly payment. 8) I think that your company solicited money from my sister under false pretences and she should be refunded her payments.    Last but not least. Does the Obama stimulus plan for students pertain to me and can I refi for a lower interest rate.

name: Deborah
review: I sent a letter last Wednesday to Sallie MAe Via E-mail. I sent it to customer service . I've  heard Nothing back as of yet. I would like some answers. I recently called and spoke to a person outside of the US. I asked them why my payment was totally going to Pay Interest Only and not the Principal. I was told the interest is 82.34 and my payment is 82.34. It is not an interest only account. At this rate the principal will never be paid off. My sister CO-Signed for my loan. I have been making payments each month. [They] have been calling her for a long time to tell her I haven't been paying. [They] have been excepting payments from me and from my sister. We didn't know we were both making payments. I never received a statement that two payments were being made each month and neither did my sister!First of all, one payment should go to pay the interest and the second payment should have been for principal only! The 1098 I that you sent me only reflexs the interest for my payments. You didn't include the interest that was coming out of my sisters second monthly payment. I think that your company solicited money from my sister under false pretences and she should be refunded her payments.     Last but not least. Does the Obama stimulus plan for students pertain to me and can I refi for a lower interest rate. I am paying a sum of 82.34 each month . The whole sum is going to pay my interest only. My principal will never be paid down at this rate. What partis suppose to go to the principal and what part goes to the Interest rate. They were also calling my sister who co-signed on my loan. They told her I wasn't making payments and that she had to pay it. This was going on for over two years. I was making payments, also. They were getting a payment each month from both of us. My statement only showed one payment. They took money from my sister under false pretenses. My sister doesn't have much money. She needs a refund of all her payments. Sallie Mae told me to pay her back myself. I can't afford to pay her back over $2,000.

name: Jessica
review: I applied for financial aid when I started attending a trade school in Pennsylvania.    I started school in March of 08'.  My payments were $10 a month.  After some time went by, after finishing school, I aquired a few late fees and decided to bring my balance up to date.  I made a payent of $50 which would leave me in the clear until April of 09'.  This payment was made 2/12/09 and I recieved a bill for $10 plus a $10 late fee on 2/23/09.  I called the company and was on hold forever.  When I finally got through, to a person who couldn't speak good english, they told me that I owed this amount. After complaining to 3 representitives I asked to speak to a supervisor, who then told me this same information. Let me step back a moment to when I made this $50 payment.  I asked this representitive If my payment amount was going to change at any time, how much it was going to be , and when they it was going to change.  I was told that after six months my payents were going to be $35.80 a month.    So now back to the supervisor, he told me the amount would be $48.82, but the representitive before him said it would be $58.00 a month.  Okay so now I am very confused and need some answers.  I asked to talk to the supervisors boss and/or manager.  I was blatinly told that managers do Not take phone calls.  Also there weren't any managers around.      Keeping in mind that my mother had to co-sign for this approval.  I had her call the company and ask questions.  They told her my payments were going to be $48.82 a month.  After all this trouble, I took the initiative to call Sallie Mae in another state, New Jersey.  When I reached someone at this location she told me that all of Sallie Mae Financial Company is moving to one big office that will then be located in Deleware. I kindly asked for a corperate number because the other office wouldn't give it to me.  In this case of all the offices merging there wasn't any number for corperate at this time and wouldn't be available until the following Monday.  This woman got loud and very rude with me on the phone before hanging up on me. I am very disappointed in the company because if they are offering financial aid for students why do I and apparently a lot of others have so much trouble with them after I am finished school and trying to pay back the money loaned to me.  I am trying to do the right thing by paying this back.  I have to because I need to keep my certification.  At the same time I can't talk to an english speaking agent and I get different information everytime I call them.If I don't pay this money back they will go after my mom and ruin her credit.  I can NOT let that happen.  So basically I am stuck making payments in what ever amount they tell me even if this changes.

name: Laura
review: In my numerous attempts to contact Sallie Mae, I have received little response.  Actually the only direct response I ever received from the company was the following: Interest rates on private loans are non-negotiable.  For further questions, please contact our Private Loan Department at 800-695-3317 for assistance.  In these difficult financial times, I need to negotiate my extravagant, unjustly, and unfair interest rate that I have been given by this private loan company.  I am close to a %14 interest rate, forcing me to pay a monthly payment of over $900 dollars!   This figure is more than my rent. I can not afford this monthly payment, and at the end of any month, I may go into Default.  I was on forbearance but my time is now up, as of November 1st.  I need to lower my interest rate ASAP so I can pay the company ANYTHING every month.  I'm 24 years old and will be about a quarter of a MILLION dollars in debt with THIS company.  When I have taken out no more than 88,000 dollars to begin with.  This may triple by the time I can pay. Please tell me, is this justified?  All I was asking Sallie Mae was to work with me to lower by interest rate, which is an astonishing %14!  I can only afford %8, making my payments no more than $450 a month.  But still SM keeps them up to almost a grand. Taking advantage of every 18 year old that wants to go to college but who does not have financial support - is how SM does business.  I wish more than anything that I, and others, can take some kind of class-action law suit.  But I don't have anything to stand on, just my debt.    And I just needed to share this. Thank you.  LK I may go into Default any month because Sallie Mae won't lower by interest rate or monthly payments.  I may eventually go bankrupt because of this company, and have a difficult START to my working life since I am only 24.

name: Camesha
review: Well I went to remington College in 2006 and I had to apply for loans to pay for tuition. well I didnt know that I was getting a private loan that I couldnt consolidate along with the others. The loan has now went into default and sallie mae will not discuss the loan with me. When I have called they transfer me out to speak with another company allied interstate. these people are rude and offer little to no assistance to their customers. Why are these loans not called private loans but rather career training loans? I feel that this is a scam and someone needs to do something about it.well now i have gotten laid off and cant afford to pay this loan. so therefor im stuck. unlike my other loans that I can placeon deferment and forbarance until im able to pay this one only causes more debt.

name: Greg
review: They cashed a check I sent them on 2/5, yet they never applied the payment to my student loan.  Called Sallie Mae and was told to contact my bank to get a copy of the front and back of the check and fax it to them.  My bank tells me it's a processed check that Sallie Mae scans into their system and my bank only has the record of the transaction and Sallie Mae has kept the check :(  P.S.- also their coupon book system is problematic in that you have to call and request a new book.  Why can't they send me a bill like everyone else ?

name: Kimberly
review: I have student loans with Sallie Mae totaling approximately $18,000 (that's including the $4,300 in interest).  I am still in school, although not considered full-time because I am pursuing a career in nursing and the courses I am currently taking are very difficult and time consuming, and my academic advisor insisted I stick with part-time.  I am also working, but unfortunately my job has recently cut my hours to about 12 hours a week, and my search for a new job has become quite stressful.  In the mean time, Sallie Mae has decided to take it upon themselves and change my repayment status, and refuses to work with me to make the payments low enough for me to handle.  I have made endless amounts of phone calls to them with no relief.  They have told me my chances of deferment or forbearance have completely expired.  I spoke with one individual who told me I could start making interest only payments at $50 a month (which I can handle), but when I called a couple days later to make the payment I was told that I couldn't do interest only payments and had to pay the full $250.55.  I have spoken to three different people since, the first one put me on hold for 6 minutes then hung up on me, the second was so rude and sounded as if he was eating his lunch while talking to me, and the third had no idea what was going on and didn't know what to tell me.  After speaking with two different managers I have received nothing but a migraine and a drained bank account...yet I STILL receive the harassing phone calls all hours of the day and night.  Why can't this company offer an economic hardship grace period of some sort?  I'm tired of them threatening me and my parents that they're going to report us to a credit agency, but I'm out of options and their refusal to help has left me drained.  No matter how many times I try to rectify the situation, I come up dumbfounded and even more frustrated.  They have the worst customer service that I have EVER experienced, half the time the service rep hardly speaks English, the other half of the time it's people that couldn't possibly care less about you.  I think the only requisite for working there is that you have to be rude and ignorant.I recently got married, and my husband and I would like to start our life together and possibly get a house once I finish school in about two years.  I am so worried (it keeps me up at night) that the repercussions of this loan with Sallie Mae is going to haunt me for the rest of my life.  Their inability to provide for their customers is going to keep me from being able to purchase a house and start a family.  My stress level is through the roof, and I have enough to worry about between school, working, paying other bills, etc.  I should be enjoying my life right now, not worrying about Sallie Mae harassing me!  Something HAS to be done.  I just can't do this anymore.

name: Maria
review: Every time I call Sallie Mae I have been given the wrong information.  On occasion I have been threatened (as well as my father, the co-signer on the loan) for not making payments.  I have several names and ID numbers of customer service representatives that have hung up on me.  I am trying to get in touch with customer service so that i can complain.  They tell me i am not allowed to complain about reps untill i bring my account current.  I AM SO FRUSTRATED BECAUSE OF THEM!I am unable to bring my account current because of all the wrong information that i am getting from a different rep every time i call.  I dont know what is true and what is false anymore.  I really need some help.

name: Joseph
review: Sallie Mae and I had an agreement to pay for my Student Loan with the option to Consolidate.  Apparently they took away that option and demand ridiculous amounts to be paid each month which would literally drive my family of 3 into ruins.  We are constantly harassed on a daily basis of greater than 8 times a day.  I was told to get a second job (already have two jobs), they told me to quit one of the jobs and get a better paying one, to ask friends and family for money and to take out another loan to pay off this loan which would eventually amount to another high debt loan.  In this day with the way the economy is, and the fact that they already ruined my credit, I have no ability to get a loan from the bank let alone put money to the side for a house, a car (in case the old one dies on me) or emergency money in case the need should ever rise.  One ludicrous discussion i had with someone from there repetitiously informed me that I owe a certain amount for nearly an hour, to which i kept informing him, I simply do not have the money for that payment only to be once again, How will you be paying for this tonight?  Please tell me why I pay taxes for for the Govt to protect me and my family when they only protect the predators that wish to make us homeless?  I love how they give money to Third World Countries and countries that have undergone war to re-establish a democratic way of life, yet they will let their own citizens who pay these taxes be eaten alive by  the likes of Sallie Mae.  Where is our protection and our Justice?  I took out the loans in order to complete college and get a better job.  I had some pitfalls in my life that prevented me to acquire the college degree I initially wanted and this left me with a hefty fine.  The school i attended did not discourage me from continuing, knowing that i had difficult times, however after reading this site I realize that Sallie Mae offered some form of compensation for the institutions in order to keep the blood money coming in.  And where was the Government to oversee this?  I'm surprised that there aren't laws keeping Government officials from receiving Bribes i mean compensations for creating laws that take away the rights of debters and completely compensate the Creditors!  Please tell me there is some form of hope and you have an answer for me.  I can't believe this site has been going on since 2005 and I have yet to see a change in the laws that protect Sallie Mae.  Does anyone actually read any of these messages?  Please respond if you do.  Thank you!We are currently in rising debt, a consolidation company has been hired to help with other debt which coincidentally was generated due to the inability to pay for the student loan from Sallie Mae.  Our Rent literally eats half my paycheck.  We do not have the money to relocate to a cheaper place and since my credit score is shot, finding another place is near impossible.  I am the only one supporting a family of 3 at the moment and things do look grim.  I have become skeptical over the abilities of those that claim that they are fighting for us and actually challenge anyone to make the difference. My sanity is on the verge of dissolution as well.  The interesting thing about my vocation is that I assist patients who find it impossible to pay for their Cancer Med.  Consider the fact that when i leave my job i'm not leaving anyone upset or worried about getting something that will prolong their quality of life for a disease that will eventually take their lives.  The not-so-kind employees at Sallie Mae proved to me that there are people out there that will push you in front of a bus in order to take the money out of your wallet.  Lets see what Barack Obama does and anyone else that claims they have our best interests at heart.

name: Amanda
review: I graduated from high school June of 04' and planned on attending college that fall. My school recomended to all the students to use Sallie Mae to obtain loans for school. My parents didn't have a lot of money so I knew they wouldn't be able to help me out with paying for school. I also had 2 jobs my senior year of high school because I knew I would need the money. Sallie Mae told me that I was not able to get a student signature loan (their main loan i guess) because I wasn't 18. So they suggested that I apply for the parent plus loan. So i applied for the parent plus loan and had my parents cosign. Sallie Mae wouldn't approve the loan because my parents credit wasn't good enough. I contacted them again and they told me I would have to wait until I turned 18 and then reapply for the loan. I was also told that my parents could cosign on that loan and that it would be approved. I asked them how that was possible if they weren't approved on the other loan and they said that the student signature loan is based on me paying the loan back and the parent plus loan is based on my parents paying back that loan. It didn't make any sense to me, but they promised that the loan would be approved. I didn't know any better and I took their word for it. That was cutting it close though because I turned 18 on August 29th and I was suppose to start school on September 9th. So my on my birthday I reapplied for a student signature loan and had my parents cosign. Sallie Mae didn't get back to me until that Wednesday the 3rd and guess what? The loan wasn't approved. So I had to scramble to try and find someone in my family with good enough credit to cosign with less than a week before I was suppose to start classes. Thankfully my grandfather was able to. So I reapplied for the 4th time on Thursday the 4th. But it was Labor Day weekend and my loan wasn't proccessed in time because of the false information they gave me and I wasn't able to attend school until the spring.  While I was in school I paid money towards the loans even though I knew I didn't have to because I knew when I graduated the payments would be too high. I was trying to be proactive. I borrowed a total of 26k in 4 loans for 3 semesters. At the end of my 3rd semester I withdrew from school intending to reapply at community college because I was not happy with the school. My 26k loan had already turned into a 35k loan by then and I knew there would be no way I would be able to make payments when i graduated. So i never reapplied to school and was promoted at my retail job.  Now that I wasn't in school I started making monthly payments to Sallie Mae. I paid $361 a month from June 06' to July of 08'. Plus all the hundreds I paid when I didn't have too. All that time I was only paying interest so the total amount I have to pay back kept growing and is still growing today. To make matters worse I lost my job in August 08' and have only been able to find a part time job in January 09'. Now I work 2 days a week for a total of 13 hours. I had put my loans into forbearance once before because of car trouble which put me 2 months behind on all my bills, but I was able to catch back up. One of the first things I did when I lost my job was try and put my loans into forbearance again. I got an email from Sallie Mae saying I was approved and everything was all set. Then in November I get another email saying I'm 2 months behind on payments. Turns out the forbearance was only for the student signature loans (which I didn't think I had but i apparently have 2) and not for the private loans (which i have 2 of also). I asked why i didn't have a problem before with forbearance and they told me that before I had applied for a different type of forbearance. (another issue that makes no sense) So they told me they would sent me an application form for the private loans and that it would only take 3-5 days. I didnt receive the form until today, February 19th and I had requested it back in November. Not only that but I had emailed them about not receiving the form multiple times without any response from them. Finaly when I get the form, I read it through and it turns out the forbearance was only for 3 months and it was in affect from November 13 08 to February 13 09. Now they want me to pay a $238 forbearance fee even though I never got the forbearance because they kept adding to my monthly payment when it was suppose to be hold. Isn't that what forbearance is for? There is no way this can be legal. I have no idea what to do at this point. I've already lost my apartment and have moved back in with my parents, I've completely cut my expenses so now all I buy is gas and pay for the loan on my car. They are constantly calling me and my grandfather 8-12 times a day. I refuse to answer the phone when they call because the last time i talked to a real person they made it out to be all my fault for taking out a loan for school because I couldn't afford to go to school in the first place. This company needs to be held accountable. I'm suprised with all these complaints nothing has been done yet. I originally borrowed 26K and now I owe over 69k, almost triple what I borrowed. I'm 22 now and the only option it seems I have left is bankruptcy. A 22 year old should not have to file for bankruptcy!

name: Judy
review: I'm a 67 year old widow with an excellent credit rating. In 2005 I co-signed for a student loan from Sallie Mae for one of my married daughters in the amount of $1,500.00. When my daughter and her husband started having some financial difficulties I paid one payment to Sallie May and with the next bill decided to pay off the entire balance of the loan which was some 2,700 odd dollars. I don't have the exact amounts at this time due to my home burning down last October but I can access them through my bank. This final payment was in July of 2006. The following September [2006] I received another bill from them in the amount of some 90.00. I called them and explained how I had paid the balance in full and was told that it would be taken care of. I heard nothing further from them either by mail or phone for an entire year. Then out of the blue I received a phone call telling me that I owed them 180.00. I had an extremely heated exchange on the phone with some guy who was not interested in the least in hearing what I had to say but kept agressively insisting that I owed this money and had better pay it. He said that the 180.00 was for late charges and interest because the last payment made on the bill [the FULL amount owed] was late. I tried to explain to him that I had sent the money in when I had received the bill. Is it my fault if they sent it out late and evidently misplaced the entire account for a year? I could not reason with this person and so ended up hanging up the phone. About a month later I get a letter telling me that they have reconsidered and will now only charge me the original 90.00 they claim I owed. They say that this amount is the late charges and interest for the late payment of the full amount of the loan. Can someone please explain to me if this is indeed the case,and this is the only amount owed, why they are also charging my daughter a further 130.00???? I have refused to pay them anything further because I have no gaurantee that somewhere down the line they will make up some other bogus charges. Now they are threatening me with ruining my credit, hauling me into court etc., etc. unless I pay them 259.32 by March 3rd. Why has'nt somebody done something about this bunch of crooks. Surely what they are doing is nothing short of usury. These people are loan sharks and they are preying on innocent hard working Americans. This whole situation has caused me a great deal of stress.I've been under a doctor's care, in part, because of this harassment. I've been through a lot in my life including the recent loss of my home, beloved pets and everything I owned. I've always paid my debts as my credit report will show. But this situation with Sallie Mae seems to be a bottomless pit where the consumer does'nt have any say against a corporation that just makes up charges that they say you owe them and that you have no recourse against.

name: Matt
review: Sallie Mae sent me a bill for my student loan two months after I graduated from college (February '06).  This loan was set up with the first payment date to be 6 months after graduation. My graduation date was December '05, however on the first payment bill it said that the loan officially begins on 07/07/05.  I tried to contest this at the time, but if you think they are hard to deal with now, imagine what they were like before everyone knew what they were doing to the economy. I quickly paid the payments until I could pay the loan off completely with a consolidation loan. When I started getting rejected loan applications I got a little suspicious of what was on my credit report since I have great credit and the income to back it.  Sallie Mae has a 3 months late payment charge on my credit report.  I disputed it through a credit report system and Sallie Mae refused the dispute. I called Sallie Mae in hopes that with the facts in my hand, they would remove the false charge on my credit report.  They told me that there was no one I could talk to about this and that there was no way they could remove the charge on my credit report.  So, they told me to dispute it through a credit bureau. I called the Federal Trade Commission and filed a report on the issue.  I want to encourage everyone on this page and anyone reading this with similar problems to do the same thing.  The FTC cannot dispute single claims, just take investigative and eventually legal action for repeated claims. The charge on my credit report is an obvious result of poor contractual organization and customer service.   I should not have received a bill until June '06.  I am sending Sallie Mae a formal complaint by mail and if I do not receive notice of the charge being dropped from my credit report, I will be taking the appropriate legal action. I have been unable to secure quality loans for the purpose of responsibly paying off debt.  I have a credit score in the 700s and have an income to support the loans.  Sallie Mae has solely caused this problem and seems determined to offer no assistance in fixing the problem they have caused me.  I plan to move to Europe shortly.  This country has let this absurdity go on for too long.

name: Rick
review: My daughter has a Sallie Mae loan she used to pay for her college. She is not in school anymore and she is working making a modest income. I am co-signed on  her loan and now I receive automated phone calls from Sallie Mae that she needs to pay her loans. I called my daughter about this and this is what she told me. She set up a payment plan with Sallie Mae that they would withdraw her payment from her checking account each month. The first month it worked. The second month it didn't She waited until Sallie Mae left a message on her phone. She called them back and asked to speak with a supervisor to try and work this out. once she was transferred, she was cut off. I continued to receive the calls from Sallie Mae as well as my daughter. The won't talk to me because it isn't my loan, but they keep calling. I called Sallie Mae and asked to speak with a supervisor twice and both times I was cut off. One time I was hung up on by the first person whom I was talking with. I never yelled but I was upset and wanted them to stop harassing my daughter and I. I was also upset that my daughter contacted Sallie Mae to put her payback on hold since she was just starting to work and money was tight because she was no longer at home and had additional expenses. Sallie Mae gladly deferred her payments but as the co-signer, they never contacted or asked me for my permission. Now they feel it is OK to harass us. The straw that broke the camel's back for me was a call my daughter received from a female Sallie Mae telemarketer who was yelling at my daughter and threatening her with financial ruination if she didn't pay her right then and there. She wanted my daughter's credit or debit card number. My daughter was upset and crying and made a bad judgment call and gave out her information to this thug. That was almost a week ago and they still have not withdrawn the funds from her account. Now she is watching her account closely to see if or when they will take out the scheduled payment and the additional payment. My family had never defaulted on any loans and we will pay our dues but something needs to happen to stop this out of control institution.   At any time, this unethical and money thirsty organization which preys on young kids has the authorization and ability to take money out of my daughters account at any time. This permission was obtained by threats and harassment to scare and intimidate people into submission. When the see an opportunity to make more interest, ethics is set aside. Two payments to Sallie Mae from one months pay will destroy my daughter.

name: Rick
review: My daughter has a Sallie Mae loan she used to pay for her college. She is not in school anymore and she is working making a modest income. I am co-signed on  her loan and now I receive automated phone calls from Sallie Mae that she needs to pay her loans. I called my daughter about this and this is what she told me. She set up a payment plan with Sallie Mae that they would withdraw her payment from her checking account each month. The first month it worked. The second month it didn't She waited until Sallie Mae left a message on her phone. She called them back and asked to speak with a supervisor to try and work this out. once she was transferred, she was cut off. I continued to receive the calls from Sallie Mae as well as my daughter. The won't talk to me because it isn't my loan, but they keep calling. I called Sallie Mae and asked to speak with a supervisor twice and both times I was cut off. One time I was hung up on by the first person whom I was talking with. I never yelled but I was upset and wanted them to stop harassing my daughter and I. I was also upset that my daughter contacted Sallie Mae to put her payback on hold since she was just starting to work and money was tight because she was no longer at home and had additional expenses. Sallie Mae gladly deferred her payments but as the co-signer, they never contacted or asked me for my permission. Now they feel it is OK to harass us.     The straw that broke the camel's back for me was a call my daughter received from a female Sallie Mae telemarketer who was yelling at my daughter and threatening her with financial ruination if she didn't pay her right then and there. She wanted my daughter's credit or debit card number. My daughter was upset and crying and made a bad judgment call and gave out her information to this thug. That was almost a week ago and they still have not withdrawn the funds from her account. Now she is watching her account closely to see if or when they will take out the scheduled payment and the additional payment. My family had never defaulted on any loans and we will pay our dues but something needs to happen to stop this out of control institution.   At any time, this unethical and money thirsty organization which preys on young kids has the authorization and ability to take money out of my daughters account at any time.
